articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates King of Malaysia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates King of Malaysia

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Al-Sultan Almutasimu Billahi Muhibbudin Tuanku Alhaj Abdul Halim Muadzam Shah Ibni Al-Marhum Sultan Badlishah on his accession to the throne of Malaysia.
					
					 Kim in the message sincerely wished the King and people of Malaysia success in their work for development, prosperity and unity of the country.
					
					 He also expressed conviction that the friendly relations between the DPRK and Malaysia would steadily develop in keeping with the common interests and desire of the two peoples.

articles.title: Greeting to Venezuelan President
articles.content:
Greeting to Venezuelan President
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Hugo Chavez Frias, president of Venezuela, as regards the fact that the foundation of the Community of Latin American and Caribbean States was officially proclaimed at the regional summit of heads of state recently held in Caracas under the sponsorship of Venezuela.
					
					 Kim in the message described the foundation of the community as a historic event that brought into a reality the long-cherished desire of the regional peoples to promote unified development through strengthened regional unity and cooperation.
					
					 Affirming the steadfast stand and will of the government and the people of the DPRK to positively develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the member states of the community, the message sincerely hoped that the countries of the community would consolidate the regional integration and achieve the common development and prosperity in closer unity.

articles.title: Greeting to Kazakhstan President
articles.content:
Greeting to Kazakhstan President
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of greeting to Nursultan Abishevich Nazarbayev, president of Kazakhstan, on its national day.
					
					 Kim in the message wished the Kazakhstan President success in the work for prosperity of the country and the people's welfare.

articles.title: Greetings to FM of Kazakhstan
articles.content:
Greetings to FM of Kazakhstan
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun on Friday sent a message of greeting to Erzhan Kazikhanov, foreign minister of Kazakhstan, on its national day.
					
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would favorably develop.

articles.title: Vice-Premier of China on Inheriting Sino-DPRK Friendship
articles.content:
Vice-Premier of China on Inheriting Sino-DPRK Friendship
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Sino-DPRK friendship should be inherited in the future, too, as it is a valuable asset provided and left by leaders of elder generations of the two countries, said Zhang Dejiang, vice-premier of the State Council of China, on Thursday.
					
					 In a talk with Han Kwang Bok, vice-premier and minister of Electronics Industry of the DPRK who is visiting China at the head of a DPRK electronics industrial working delegation, at the Diaoyutai State Guesthouse in Beijing, Zhang said that China and the DPRK are friendly neighbors sharing the same mountain and rivers.
					
					 He, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Communist Party of China, said that several visits to China paid by General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the recent brisk exchange of high-level delegations between the two countries have made great contributions to boosting the bilateral friendly relations.
					
					 We are rejoiced over many achievements made by the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation under the correct leadership of Kim Jong Il, he added. 
					
					 Zhang gave a reception in honor of the DPRK delegation that day.

articles.title: Delegation of World Peace Federation Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of World Peace Federation Leaves
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the World Peace Federation led by President Moon Hyung Jin left here Friday.

articles.title: Mongolia's Significant Anniversaries Marked
articles.content:
Mongolia's Significant Anniversaries Marked 

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar hosted a reception on Friday on the occasions of the 90th anniversary of the victorious People's Revolution of Mongolia, the 100th anniversary of national liberation and the 2220th anniversary of formation of the first state.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, and others and diplomatic envoys of foreign countries and representatives of international organizations here. 
					
					 Staff members of the Mongolian embassy were present there.
					
					 The Mongolian ambassador spoke at the reception. 
					
					 Mongolia and the DPRK have long-standing friendly relations, he said, stressing the need to boost the traditional friendly relations as required by the new circumstance.
					
					 He expressed the conviction that the bilateral relations can make substantial contributions to ensuring peace and stability in Northeast Asia.
					
					 He wished that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields in the future, too.
					
					 Pak Ui Chun said in his speech that the Korean people are pleased with many achievements made by the government and people of Mongolia in their efforts to improve the standard of people's living.
					
					 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and the leaders of the elder generations of Mongolia have continued to favorably develop in various fields, he added.
					
					 He said the DPRK would make positive efforts to boost the bilateral relations in all sectors.

articles.title: Sports Contests for Osandok Prize Open
articles.content:
Sports Contests for Osandok Prize Open
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Sports contests for Osandok Prize opened with due ceremony on the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, in the DPRK.
					
					 Their participants will compete in such events as ice-hockey, figure-skating, speed skating, short-track speed skating, and skiing in various parts of the DPRK including Pyongyang and Lake Samji.
					
					 An opening ceremony took place at the Ice Rink in Pyongyang on Friday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and sports persons.
					
					 Kim Pyong Sik, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, made an inaugural speech.

articles.title: DPRK Wins Popularity in International Acrobatic Festivals
articles.content:
DPRK Wins Popularity in International Acrobatic Festivals
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has distinguished itself in international acrobatic festivals held this year.
					
					 The DPRK participated in the 19th Massy International Circus Festival held in France, with physical acrobatics Fliers.
					
					 The Fliers represented the spirit of the DPRK advancing with the might of Songun (military-first) politics.
					
					 After seeing the performance, the audience termed it an amazing and fantastic feat. 
					
					 It won the Prize of the President of the Republic of France, the festival's top prize.
					
					 The Fliers took gold prizes at the 12th Latina International Circus Festival and the 9th Grenoble International Circus Festival.
					
					 An aerial stunt Conquerors performed by DPRK acrobats also won the top prize at the 13th Wuqiao International Acrobatics Festival held in Hubei Province, China in October this year.

articles.title: "Sangphyong Coin" of Ri Dynasty
articles.content:
"Sangphyong Coin" of Ri Dynasty

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- "Sangphyong Coin" is metallic currency used by Ri Dynasty from 1633 to the early 20th century.
					
					Sangphyong is the name of a central government body.
					
					  A coin is one mun or phun, ten coins are one don or jon and 100 coins are one ryang.  
					
					 "Sangpyong Coin" brought about a great change in the socio-economic life of the people and in the development of the currency system in the country.

articles.title: Kwangbop Temple
articles.content:
Kwangbop Temple
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Kwangbop Temple, which was built in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (277 B.C.-668 A.D.), has been preserved in Mt. Taesong in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The Buddhist temple had Pogwang and Myongbu halls and Chilsong Shrine, according to a monument to the temple which was rebuilt in 1727. 
					
					 The temple was destroyed by the U.S. bombing in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953) but was restored to the original state in Juche 79 (1990) thanks to the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea for preserving cultural assets.
					
					 Conspicuous in the temple are the Taeung Hall, a five-storeyed octagonal pagoda, Tongsung and Sosung shrines. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung visited the temple on February 12, Juche 80 (1991) and called for properly preserving the temple, one of the cultural heritages of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Winter Mingyuegou Meeting
articles.content:
Winter Mingyuegou Meeting  

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Eighty years has elapsed since a historic meeting was held in Mingyuegou, Yanji County on December 16, Juche 20 (1931).
					
					 President Kim Il Sung convened the meeting of cadres of party and Young Communist League organizations to discuss putting an end to the history of the national liberation struggle in the early 20th century, fraught with failures and setbacks. 
					
					 The meeting focused on launching an armed struggle against the Japanese invaders.
					
					 With no sovereign state at that time, it was impossible to fight the invaders through a regular war.
					
					 Guerilla warfare was considered impossible either, with neither state-backing home front nor assistance of regular forces.
					
					 Under such circumstances, the President set forth a unique policy of guerrilla warfare, believing that the popular masses immediately represent the state, home front and regular forces. 
					
					 The meeting also discussed building revolutionary armed forces and mass foundation, forming an anti-Japanese joint front of the Korean and Chinese people and other pending issues.
					
					 It served as an occasion in turning the Korean people's anti-Japanese struggle into an armed struggle under the slogan "Oppose armed forces with armed forces and resist counterrevolutionary violence with revolutionary violence!"

articles.title: Slogans Written on Trees Laud Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Slogans Written on Trees Laud Kim Jong Suk

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Many trees bearing slogans lauding Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, were discovered throughout the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 During the anti-Japanese armed struggle, the guerillas and revolutionaries in the homeland wrote slogans on trees in thick forests, in praise of feats Kim Jong Suk performed in devotedly defending President Kim Il Sung, who was leading the anti-Japanese war to victory.
					
					 Slogan-bearing trees were found in the Mt. Paektu secret camp, Yonsa, Musan and other areas.
					
					 They include "Anti-Japanese woman general advanced into the homeland in 1942 in response to Kim Il Sung's line of national liberation," "We are led by Kim Jong Suk, a woman hero of Mt. Paektu" and "Anti-Japanese woman hero from Mt. Paektu devotes herself to decisive battles for national liberation".
					
					 Some of the slogans highly praise Kim Jong Suk for ensuring the continuity of the Korean revolution.
					
					 With the approach of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, December 24, the Korean people recollect her revolutionary feats, hardening their determination to carry forward the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Struggle against Swaggering Imperialism Called for
articles.content:
Struggle against Swaggering Imperialism Called for

					Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Only when the imperialists' vicious counterrevolutionary offensive is beat back with a revolutionary offensive waged by powerful driving forces in the staunch anti-imperialist spirit is it possible to protect the revolutionary gains, the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It is necessary to see through the imperialists' weakness and put up a courageous struggle against them, without being frightened by their bravado, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The anti-Japanese guerrilla army, which the Imperial Japanese army called "a drop in the ocean" in the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, won victory in the fight against the one million-strong troops of the Japanese imperialists armed with machine guns, artillery pieces, aircraft, etc., and thus achieved the liberation of Korea. This was possible because the guerrilla army was strong in the anti-imperialist spirit and faith. During the Fatherland Liberation War the army and people of the DPRK defeated the U.S. imperialists, chieftain of imperialism, and their lackeys mainly because they had strong anti-imperialist spirit and the firm will to defend the country.
					
					 Any illusion about and fear of imperialism make it hard to believe in one's own strength and slacken the anti-imperialist spirit, being infected with war-weariness. This will finally end up yielding to imperialism.
					
					 One should counter the imperialists' use of force in kind. If a country neglects the work to bolster the capability for self-defense, while worrying about difficulties before it, it will be hard to humble the arrogance of the imperialists,
					
					 It is thanks to the staunch anti-imperialist spirit and a powerful driving force that the Workers' Party and people of Korea have firmly protected the gains of revolution and sovereignty of the country and nation while frustrating the imperialists' highhanded practices and moves for aggression.
					
					 The article calls on the revolutionary countries and peoples to bravely meet the challenge of the imperialists with the above-said spirit and forces and thus defend the supreme interests of the country and nation and build a new independent and peaceful world.

articles.title: S. Korean Army Holds Landing Exercise
articles.content:
S. Korean Army Holds Landing Exercise
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The 39th division of the south Korean puppet army Wednesday staged landing exercise aimed at invading the DPRK, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					
					 A mobile battalion under the division held the exercise of landing on a hill by rope from helicopter hovering over the place where it is stationed before infiltrating into targeted area. 
					
					 The puppet warmongers have been engaged in staging military exercises aimed to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK despite their lip-service for "flexibility of policy towards north". This only discloses their true colors as war maniacs.

articles.title: Solution to Issue of Sexual Slavery Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Solution to Issue of Sexual Slavery Called for in S. Korea
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Measure Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps sponsored the 1,000th Wednesday rally to solve the issue of the "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Dec. 14. 
					
					 There took place a ceremony of unveiling a peace monument depicting victims who were killed after suffering all sorts of disgrace and insult as sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					
					 Speakers at the rally said that the Wednesday rally which started in 1992 in demand of the settlement of the crime of forced sexual slavery has taken place 1,000 times. However, Japan has denied the truth about it, far from making any apology and reparation for the crimes committed by Japan against the Korean people in the past, they noted, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are also sidestepping the issue. The present chief executive at talks with the Japanese prime minister did not even mention the issue of sexual slavery. 
					
					 They declared that they would continue the Wednesday rally in solidarity with the people from all walks of life till Japan opts to settle the past. 
					
					 Meetings condemning the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity simultaneously took place in 30 cities of nine regions including Pusan, Ulsan, Taegu, Taejon, Inchon, Suwon of Kyonggi Province and Thongyong of South Kyongsang Province. 
					
					 Solidarity statements and messages were sent to the meetings from many organizations of different social standings of south Korea, overseas compatriot organizations, foreign organizations and personages. 
					
					 Civic and public organizations in South Kyongsang Province held a press conference in Changwon on the same day on the occasion of the 1,000th rally to demand the settlement of the above-said issue. 
					
					 Similar solidarity actions were staged that day in at least 40 cities of nine countries and regions including the U.S., Japan, Germany, Canada and Italy.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Suppresses Progressive Journalist
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Suppresses Progressive Journalist

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean fascist police searched the office of a journalist of Internet paper Jaju Minbo on Wednesday.
					
					 The puppet police took this action on charge that the articles written by the journalist were a violation of the "National Security Law" and ordered him to appear before the Security Investigation Group.
					
					 Of late the south Korean puppet group instigated the ultra-conservative media hell-bent on distorting realities, inventing lies and hatching plots to put even broadcasting services under its control and ride roughshod while intensifying the suppression of progressive media including Jaju Minbo.
					
					 In the last September, too, unidentified hooligans hacked the homepage of the above-said newspaper office, disturbing its business and making threatening phone calls.
					
					 The man concerned of Jaju Minbo declared it was an unjust action to charge that the publication of the articles written on the basis of a review and analysis of what was made known through south Korean media was a violation of the NSL.

articles.title: Cyber Terrorists' Money-dealing Disclosed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Cyber Terrorists' Money-dealing Disclosed in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed in south Korea that there was money dealing among those who mounted Ddos attacks on the homepages of the Central Election Management Commission and an independent candidate during the Oct. 26 election.
					
					 Before and after this scam took place, the secretary of Pak Hui Thae, speaker of the "National Assembly", gave 10 million won to the secretary of Choe Ku Sik, lawmaker from the "Grand National Party".
					
					 In mid-November 90 million won was sent to the account number of the person who carried out the cyber attack.
					
					 The disclosure of this fact at a time when truth about the cases of cyber terrorism is being brought to light one after another once again clearly proves that the GNP is behind these crimes.
					
					 It was already known to everybody that Pak is affiliated to the GNP and his secretary hatched a plot with the secretary of Choe for cyber attack, drinking all night long on the eve of election. 
					
					 The party of traitors has denied its crimes, asserting this was done by an individual but it is now left with no excuse to evade the responsibility.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea FTA Censured by British Organizations
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea FTA Censured by British Organizations

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a statement on Nov. 29 denouncing the U.S.-south Korea "Free Trade Agreement".
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S.-south Korea FTA is a disastrous agreement.
					
					 FTA will turn south Korea into a subject country of the U.S. and lead the people to bankruptcy, unemployment and poverty.
					
					 South Korea is being steadily reduced into a colony of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 We positively support the south Korean people in their just struggle against the U.S.-south Korea FTA and bitterly condemn the puppet group for brutally cracking down on the protesters.

articles.title: Single-Minded Unity of DPRK Introduced
articles.content:
Single-Minded Unity of DPRK Introduced

					Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet homepage on Dec. 2 an article titled "By Dint of Single-hearted Unity" illustrated with a photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people have defended their socialism and made signal achievements in economic construction while resolutely frustrating the imperialists' sanctions and their moves to stifle it by dint of single-minded unity, the article said, and went on:
					
					 That is why south Korean people are growing stronger in their voices praising the DPRK where the army and the people are dynamically pushing forward socialist construction, united close around Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 They note the DPRK has achieved the great unity between the army and the people with their leader as a central figure, adding that this is the true picture of its society. Having such invincible might, the DPRK is countering the high-handed policies of the imperialists with the toughest stand, the article noted, and continued: 
					
					 The might of the DPRK dignified thanks to its single-hearted unity makes them confident of the future when the nation will eternally prosper.
					
					 They are renewing their firm will to wage a dynamic struggle for independent reunification and peace and prosperity, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the lodestar of the national reunification.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Lauded
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk Lauded
						

					Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Russia and Nigeria on Dec. 8 posted special write-ups on Internet homepage on the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The Young Communist League of Russian Federation posted an article under the title of "Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il" with his photo.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 The supreme commander has put the defense capability of the DPRK on the highest level. 
					
					 He laid down a line of economic construction in the era of Songun and made sure that the country pushed forward the work to modernize the defense industry on its own efforts and with its own technology and resources.
					
					 He, at the same time, put socialism on a new scientific basis and led the Korean people to victory in the confrontation with the imperialist allied forces, firmly defending socialism.
					
					 Recalling that he has brought about a landmark phase in socialist construction, the article pointed out that all the achievements made by the DPRK are the shining fruition of the plans and energetic leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea carried articles entitled "Legendary Woman Guerilla Commander", "Her Immortal Exploits" and "the Mother's Wishes" under the headline "Kim Jong Suk Always Enjoys Praises ".
					
					 Noting that Kim Jong Suk is always lauded not only by the Korean people but by the world progressive people, they stressed she left behind lots of stories, while winning fame as an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					 They made a detailed account of the facts that she devoted herself to ensuring the safety of President Kim Il Sung at all times not only during the anti-Japanese war but in the period after the national liberation and brought Kim Jong Il up to be a great successor to the Juche revolutionary cause.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Marked by Organizations of Peru, Bangladesh
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Marked by Organizations of Peru, Bangladesh

					Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Peru and Bangladesh released bulletins on Dec. 9 on the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism in its bulletin carried an article accompanied with photos of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The article said that Kim Jong Il has pursued the original Songun politics based on the Juche idea, protecting the sovereignty of the country and wisely leading the cause of national reunification and global independence.
					
					 It also introduced in detail Kim Jong Suk's revolutionary life and feats.
					
					 The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea in its bulletin carried an article titled "Kim Jong Suk's desire".
					
					 What Kim Jong Suk desired was, in a word, to see the country rich and powerful where people enjoy a happy life, true to the cause of President Kim Il Sung, the article said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Suk had devoted her all to the country and its people to the last moments of her life since she embarked upon the road of revolution for the liberation of the country at her early age.
					
					 As desired by her, Kim Jong Il unrolled a plan for building a thriving socialist nation and has energetically worked to put it into practice.
					
					 The desire of Kim Jong Suk whom the Korean people have always admired is being translated into a shining reality.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Holidays Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Holidays Marked Abroad
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries to mark the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 94th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero. They included meeting, lecture, book and photo exhibition and film show in Nepal, Ecuador and Italy and organized by the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement between Dec. 6 and 10.
					
					Displayed in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos on the revolutionary feats of the peerless great persons and books and photos introducing the efforts of the Korean people for socialist construction.
					
					 Films shown included the Korean films "The Country Shining Thanks to the Army of Mt. Paektu" and "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation."
					
					 A department director of the C.C., the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist) noted the DPRK has firmly defended the socialist system and the people's happiness from the imperialist allied forces' military threat and moves for aggression as it has held Kim Jong Il as the Supreme Commander of the KPA.
					
					  The chairman of the Ecuador-Guayaquil Institute for Friendship with the Korean People noted although the DPRK is not big in its territory, it is an independent power rare to be found in the world as it is fully demonstrating its dignity and might. This is ascribable to the fact that it is guided by the immortal Juche Idea and under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, he stressed.
					
					 A department director of the Lazio Branch of the Communist Party of Italy noted Kim Jong Il has developed and enriched the immortal Juche Idea, Songun Idea founded by Kim Il Sung and turned socialist Korea into a political and ideological power and military power by pursuing Songun politics.
					
					  Secretary of a branch of the Communist Party of Italy praised Kim Jong Suk as a woman revolutionary who dedicated herself to the liberation of the country and the building of a new country and revolutionary armed forces and for the women's social emancipation.
					
					 Members of the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement stressed the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il is a true political mode for all African countries to follow.

articles.title: Iran Condemns U.S. Military Presence in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Iran Condemns U.S. Military Presence in Afghanistan

					 Tehran, December 15 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali-Akbar Salehi in a diplomatic meeting on Dec. 13 condemned the U.S. military presence in Afghanistan.
					
					 He described the existence of foreign military bases in the region as the cause of instability in regional countries.
					
					 He said the Islamic Republic is against any treaty that would enable the U.S. forces to remain in Afghanistan.
					
					 Iran believes in the competence of Afghan forces in providing security for their own country, he noted.

articles.title: Iran Demands Apology from U.S.
articles.content:
Iran Demands Apology from U.S.
						

					 Tehran, December 15 (KCNA) -- Spokesman of the Foreign Ministry of Iran Ramin Mehmanparast in a press conference on Tuesday rejected the U.S. request for return of its downed drone.
					
					  The chief executive of the U.S. has asked Iran to return the downed drone aircraft.
					
					 According to Mehmanparast, Obama forgot that the drone violated the Iranian airspace to spy the country, an action of violating the international laws and regulations and encroaching upon the sovereignty of Iran.
					
					 "Obama should formally apologize to Iran for violating the airspace of the country," the spokesman said.

articles.title: Iran Rejects U.S. Request for Return of Drone
articles.content:
Iran Rejects U.S. Request for Return of Drone

					 Tehran, December 15 (KCNA) -- Iran's minister of Defense and Armed Forces Logistics on Dec. 13 rejected the U.S. request for return of its downed drone aircraft.
					
					 "The U.S drone is now property of Iran and our country will decide the next to be followed", said the minister.

articles.title: Russia to Ensure National Security by Itself: FM
articles.content:
Russia to Ensure National Security by Itself: FM

					 Moscow, December 15 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov recently declared that Russia will ensure its national security by its own efforts.
					
					 NATO's plan is arousing concern as it is aimed to deploy in its member nations elements of the missile defense system so that almost territories of Russia may lie in its range, he said, adding that Russia needs legally-binding arrangements.
					
					 The right of Russia to ensure the security of its territories by its own efforts should be respected, he stressed.

articles.title: New Highway Inaugurated in Anhui Province of China
articles.content:
New Highway Inaugurated in Anhui Province of China
						

					 Beijing, December 15 (KCNA) -- A new highway was inaugurated in Anhui Province of China on Monday.
					
					 It links Anhui with Jiangsu and Henan provinces and its total length is 204.5 km.
					
					 It is reported that it would give beneficial condition to the economic development of the region.

articles.title: Vaccination of Epidemic Influenza in Cuba
articles.content:
Vaccination of Epidemic Influenza in Cuba

					 Havana, December 15 (KCNA) -- Vaccination of epidemic influenza is progressing apace in Cuba.
					
					 More than 80,000 inhabitants have been inoculated in ten days since the start of vaccination.
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of inhabitants will be reportedly inoculated during the vaccination that will last till Dec. 21.

articles.title: Venezuela Launches Anti-poverty Program
articles.content:
Venezuela Launches Anti-poverty Program

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Monday launched an anti-poverty program merged with other social programs to reduce poverty in the country.
					
					 He said the new strategy seeks to reduce the number of people in poverty in Venezuela to 2.5 million in 2012 in its first stage.
					
					 The Venezuelan government has said that poverty rate in Venezuela declined from 49 percent to 27.4 percent in the first half of 2011.

articles.title: More U.S. Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More U.S. Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan 

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- More U.S. soldiers keen on "anti-terrorist war" in Afghanistan met deaths due to the ceaseless attacks of the resistance forces of the country.
					
					 As of Tuesday, Dec. 13, 2011, at least 1,731 members of the U.S. military had died in Afghanistan as a result of the U.S.-led invasion of Afghanistan in late 2001, according to the U.S. Defense Department.
					
					 Since the start of U.S. military operations in Afghanistan, 15,090 U.S. service members have been wounded in hostile actions.

articles.title: U.S. Military Helicopters Crashed
articles.content:
U.S. Military Helicopters Crashed

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Two U.S. military helicopters crashed in a military base in Tacoma City, Washington State, the U.S. on Dec. 12.
					
					 Four GIs aboard the helicopters were killed.

articles.title: OECD Unemployment Rate Rises
articles.content:
OECD Unemployment Rate Rises

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Across the OECD area, around 45.1 million people were unemployed in October, the Paris-based Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said Tuesday.

articles.title: Economic Growth of BRIC Countries
articles.content:
Economic Growth of BRIC Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- BRIC countries, namely Brazil, Russia, India and China, on the other hand, are expected to sustain a "robust" economic growth in the near future, reaching 6.3 percent in 2012, according to a survey data released on Dec. 12.

articles.title: Cambodia Inaugurates Roads
articles.content:
Cambodia Inaugurates Roads

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Cambodia recently inaugurated two roads in the northwestern area. A ceremony for opening them to traffic was held on Dec. 13 with the prime minister of Cambodia attending.
					
					 The two roads are 144 kilometers long altogether. It is said that the roads will contribute to the economic development of the country.

articles.title: Mongolia's Trade Up
articles.content:
Mongolia's Trade Up

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Mongolia's foreign trade volume reached about 10.3 billion U.S. dollars in the first 11 months of this year, up 89.4 percent compared to the same period in 2010, the official news agency Montsame reported Tuesday.

articles.title: Flood Damage Increases in Kenya
articles.content:
Flood Damage Increases in Kenya

					 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Flood ravaging several parts of Kenya has killed at least 24 people and displaced 98,000 in the east African nation as of Dec. 11.
					
					 Heavy rains washed away bridges and rendered many roads impassable. Relief measures for the inhabitants in the afflicted areas are being taken.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Russia
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Russia
						

					 Moscow, December 15 (KCNA) -- A 5.3-magnitude earthquake hit Sakhalin of Russia on Dec. 12.
					
					 The epicenter was about 150 km north of Poronaisk.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Hugo Chavez
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a Hugo Chavez

					Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea envio el dia 15 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Bolivariana  de Venezuela, Hugo Chavez, en relacion con que quedo proclamada oficialmente la fundacion de la Comunidad de Estados Latinoamericanos y Caribenos (Celac) en la Cumbre de Jefes de Estado y Gobierno de la region efectuada en Caracas bajo los auspicios de Venezuela.
					
					  El remitente senala que la fundacion de la Celac es el evento historico que llevo a la realidad el deseo de los pueblos de la region de fortalecer la unidad y la cooperacion de esta y fomentar el desarrollo unificado.
					
					  Afirma la invariable posicion y la voluntad del gobierno y el pueblo de la RPDC de desarrollar activamente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con los paises miembros de la Celac y desea de todo corazon que los paises de esta comunidad, unidos con mas firmeza, consoliden la fusion de la region y logren el desarrollo y la prosperidad comunes.

articles.title: Varios paises y organizacion regional celebran efemerides coreanas
articles.content:
Varios paises y organizacion regional celebran efemerides coreanas

					Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 20o aniversario del nombramiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il como Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del 94o del nacimiento de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, tuvieron lugar del dia 6 al 10 mitines, conferencias, exhibiciones de libros y fotos y proyecciones filmicas en Nepal, Ecuador, Italia y el Secretariado del Movimiento Panafricano.
					
					En los lugares de exhibicion estaban expuestos las obras del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente  Kim Jong Il y las fotos alusivas a sus hazanas revolucionarias, los libros y fotos que dan a conocer al pueblo coreano que lucha por la construccion socialista.
					
					En el encuentro de cine, se proyectaron las peliculas coreanas "La patria que brilla con las fuerzas armadas del monte Paektu" y "Lluvia de chispas de la gran potencia prospera".
					
					El jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido Comunista Unido de Nepal (Maoist) dijo que gracias al nombramiento de Su Excelencia          Kim Jong Il como Comandante Supremo del EPC, Corea pudo defender fidedignamente el regimen socialista y la felicidad del pueblo en medio de las amenazas militares y maniobras de agresion de las fuerzas aliadas imperialistas.
					
					El presidente del Instituto Ecuatoriano para la Amistad con el pueblo coreano en Guayaquil, subrayo que Corea, aunque no es grande su territorio, es una potencia independiente unica en el mundo que hace gala de su dignidad y poderio, lo que se debe enteramente a la direccion del Songun de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il tomando la idea Juche como guia directriz.
					
					El jefe de departamento de la sucursal de Lazio del Partido Comunista de Italia enfatizo que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il desarrollo y enriquecio la inmortal idea Juche, la de Songun creada por el Presidente       Kim Il Sung y mediante la original politica de Songun, convirtio la Corea socialista en una potencia politica, ideologica y militar.
					
					El secretario de una sucursal de la misma entidad politica elogio a la Heroina Kim Jong Suk como la revolucionaria quien dedico toda su vida para la liberacion del pais, la construccion de nueva patria, la creacion de las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias y la lucha para la liberacion social de las mujeres.
					
					Los integrantes del Secretariado del Movimiento Panafricano alabaron la politica de Songun del Dirigente Kim Jong Il como autentico modo de politica a ser aprendida por todos los paises africanos.

articles.title: Acrobacias coreanas admiran al mundo
articles.content:
Acrobacias coreanas admiran al mundo

					Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En el ano 100 (2011) de la Era Juche, los acrobatas coreanos admiraron al mundo al presentar las piezas penetradas por los increibles movimientos diestros en varias escenas internacionales.
					
					Ellos presentaron la acrobacia corporal "Aviadores" en el 19o Festival Internacional de Circo de Massy celebrada en Francia.
					
					Esta obra mostro a traves de las habilidades artisticas el impetu de la Corea del Songun que avanza hacia el mundo.
					
					Las participantes en el festival estimaron: "este festival era el motivo para presentar la acrobacia coreana", "la acrobacia coreana se diferencia completamente con las de otros paises", "misteriosos y excelentes movimientos tecnicos basados en la fisica robusta".
					
					A la acrobacia "Aviadores" se otorgo el premio del presidente de Francia, el maximo en el festival.
					
					Esta obra llamo atencion de las personas ganando los premios de oro en el 12o Festival Internacional de Circo de Latina y el 9o Festival Internacional de Circo de Grenoble.
					
					En octubre pasado tuvo lugar el 13o Festival Internacional de Circo de Wuqiao en la provincia de Hebei de China.
					
					En esta ocasion los acrobatas coreanos mostraron la acrobacia aerea "Conquistadores" con los movimientos de alto nivel.
					
					Ganaron la maxima nota en dos funciones de examen y recibieron el premio de Leon de Oro, maximo premio del festival.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun insiste en la lucha audaz contra el imperialismo
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun insiste en la lucha audaz contra el imperialismo 

					Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Solo cuando los paises y naciones en la revolucion responden a la ofensiva contrarrevolucionaria de los imperialistas con la otra revolucionaria basada en el firme espiritu antiimperialista y las poderosas fuerzas autoctonas, pueden defender las conquistas de la revolucion, la soberania del pais y la dignidad de la nacion.
					
					Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido en su edicion de este viernes y prosigue: 
					
					Hay que calar a fondo la vulnerabilidad de los imperialistas y luchar audazmente contra ellos sin perder el animo ante su fanfarroneria.
					
					En el periodo de la lucha armada antijaponesa la Guerrilla Antijaponesa, llamada por Japon como un "mijo en el mar", logro la liberacion de la patria al vencer a un millon de imperialistas japoneses armados con ametralladoras, canones, aviones, etc. Es porque fue un destacamento de acero integrado por los combatientes fuertes en la conviccion y en el espiritu antiimperialista. 
					
					Por contar con ese espiritu y la voluntad de defensa de la patria, el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos vencieron a los imperialistas norteamericanos y sus fuerzas satelites en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (1950-1953). 
					
					La ilusion y temor por el imperialismo debilitan la confianza en su propia fuerza y el espiritu antiimperialista y contagian la idea pesimista sobre la guerra, y por fin, hacen rendirse ante el imperialismo. 
					
					Hay que responder con la fuerza a la fuerza de los imperialistas.
					
					Si menosprecian la capacidad de autodefensa nacional vacilando ante las dificultades inminentes, no pueden vencer a los imperialistas arrogantes. 
					
					Hoy dia, el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano frustran el despotismo y las maniobras agresivas de los imperialistas y defienden con firmeza las conquistas de la revolucion y la soberania del pais y nacion porque tienen firme espiritu antiimperialista y cuentan con poderosas fuerzas autoctonas.
					
					Los paises y naciones en la revolucion deben hacer frente rotundo a los desafios de los imperialistas con el firme espiritu antiimperialista y las poderosas fuerzas autoctonas para defender los intereses supremos de la patria y la nacion y construir un nuevo mundo independiente y pacifico.
